text: as villages are demolished and replaced
with high-rise buildings the largest
human migration in the history of the
planet is underway the Chinese
government will move 250 million people
in rural to urban areas by 2025
but as village life gets buried in
China's past it could be more than just
homes that are lost some things are not
easily relocated
in the city finding a home for ancient
village traditions once passed down
through families and close-knit
neighbors can be a complicated endeavor
underneath a highway overpass on the
dusty outskirts of Beijing laid Poong
practices the traditional music of his
ancestors five years ago mr. pong and
his bandmates were all neighbors in a
village practicing regularly as it had
been done for generations but the
village was demolished to make way for a
golf course now all the musicians live
in different parts of Beijing and
getting together to practice as well as
finding a practice space has become a
challenge mr. Lai works for the city's
public transportation department and he
lives on the 18th floor of this new
high-rise building drums and chanting
are simply too loud for the neighbors
here to make things more complicated now
in his urban life he has been having
trouble finding young people who are
interested in the musical traditions
there were so much
the subject of land and development is
so sensitive here that mr. Lai is
uncomfortable visiting the place where
his old home once stood though the
former village has not yet been
developed into a golf course or anything
else the fields are still guarded by
security to deal with it to icon and so
